  • User story #43 - Give me t3h codes Task #44 - task 1
    User story #43 - Give me t3h codes
Cool - you're using Firebug, too - so do we!
As you probably know, Firebug has awesome monitoring and profiling features, which in turn means The Bug Genie will probably be a bit slow if you have Firebug enabled with it. To learn how to disable Firebug for this site only, see Disabling Firebug.

As soon as Firebug is disabled for The Bug Genie, this message will go away. Promise.

Type of bug
Not triaged
Triage bug type
Clear bug type
or click to select a new bug type:
  • Crash: Bug causes crash or data loss / asserts in the debug release
  • Major usability: Impairs usability in key scenarios
  • Minor usability: Impairs usability in secondary scenarios
  • Balancing: Enables degenerate usage strategies that harm the experience
  • Visual and Sound Polish: Aesthetic issues
  • Localization
  • Documentation: A documentation issue
 Please wait...
Likelihood
Not triaged
Triage likelihood
Clear likelihood
or click to select a new likelihood:
  • Blocking further progress on the daily build
  • A User would return the product / cannot RTM / the team would hold the release for this bug
  • A User would likely not purchase the product / will show up in review / clearly a noticeable issue
  • A Pain – users won't like this once they notice it / a moderate number of users won't buy
  • Nuisance – not a big deal but noticeable / extremely unlikely to affect sales
 Please wait...
Effect
Not triaged
Triage effect
Clear effect
or click to select a new effect:
  • Will affect all users
  • Will affect most users
  • Will affect average number of users
  • Will only affect a few users
  • Will affect almost no one

Formatting tips

The Bug Genie will automatically add new lines when you add two new lines in your text, whereas one new line is used for formatting as you type. To force a new line, use the <br> tag: "There is a new<br>line here".
See more formatting tips in WikiFormatting.

Formatting tips

You can create a link directly to a wikipedia page by using the "WIKIPEDIA:" link namespace: "Here is a link to the wikipedia article about [[WIKIPEDIA:Norway|Norway]].
See more formatting tips in WikiFormatting.

Formatting tips

Code samples are best presented in <source></source> tags. The Bug Genie uses GeSHi for syntax highlighting with support for over 100 languages! (<source lang="php"><?php echo "fu"; ?></source>)
See more formatting tips in WikiFormatting.

Formatting tips

To create a bulleted list, start one or more lines with a star ("* bulleted list item"). You can create a numbered list by using the hash/pund sign instead ("# numbered list item").
See more formatting tips in WikiFormatting.

Formatting tips

To auto-link to an existing issue, write "issue", "bug", "ticket" or the issue type (like "bug report" or "enhancement") followed by the issue number (ex: "<span class="example">ticket #3</span>" or "<span class="example">bug report MYPROJ-1</span>"). Enclose sourcecode samples in <source></source>; tags.
See more formatting tips in WikiFormatting.

Formatting tips

To auto-link to an existing issue, write "issue", "bug", "ticket" or the issue type (like "bug report" or "enhancement") followed by the issue number (ex: "<span class="example">ticket #3</span>" or "<span class="example">bug report MYPROJ-1</span>"). Enclose sourcecode samples in <source></source>; tags.
See more formatting tips in WikiFormatting.

Formatting tips

URLs will be automatically transformed to links. If you want to add a title, use the link formatter: [[http://awesome.com/something An awesome link]].
See more formatting tips in WikiFormatting.
